channel.title: Mike Brady's Baby Milk Action podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast based on Mike Brady's Boycott Nestle - Protect Infants blog
channel.itunes:author: Mike Brady
channel.itunes:summary: A weekly update on the baby milk campaign and Nestle boycott from Baby Milk Action's Campaigns and Networking Coordinator. Look for my Podcast in the iTunes Store
channel.description: Weekly podcasts on infant feeding issues, protecting breastfeeding, reducing risks of formula feeding, holding baby food companies to account, promoting the Nestle boycott and much more.

item.title: Podcast 18 February 2008
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Nestle accused of price fixing again
item.itunes:summary: Thank you for your support. Breastfeeding Manifesto campaign on UK formula regulations. In need of guidance. Taking stock. Making laws work.
item.description: Thank you for your support. Breastfeeding Manifesto campaign on UK formula regulations. In need of guidance. Taking stock. Making laws work.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula

channel.title: Podcast 11 February 2008
channel.itunes:author: Mike Brady
channel.itunes:subtitle: Nestle accused of price fixing again
channel.itunes:summary: Scotland's Forumla Regulations still stand - for now. Nestle accused of price fixing again. Urgent action on the UK formula regulations. Nestle accused of price fixing yet again (not the same story as on Tuesday!). How can we stop corporations abusing human rights?
channel.description: Scotland's Forumla Regulations still stand - for now. Nestle accused of price fixing again. Urgent action on the UK formula regulations. Nestle accused of price fixing yet again (not the same story as on Tuesday!). How can we stop corporations abusing human rights?

item.title: Podcast 4 February 2008
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Reducing the risks of feeding formula to babies
item.itunes:summary: Brendan O'Neill attacks those calling for a regulated formula market. Ireland's new guidance on reducing formula risks. LCPs blamed for causing illness in some formula-fed babies. We need to monitor the safety of new ingredients in formula - don't begrudge formula-fed infants this protection. Consolidation in the baby food industry.
item.description: Brendan O'Neill attacks those calling for a regulated formula market. Ireland's new guidance on reducing formula risks. LCPs blamed for causing illness in some formula-fed babies. We need to monitor the safety of new ingredients in formula - don't begrudge formula-fed infants this protection. Consolidation in the baby food industry.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula

item.title: Podcast 28 January 2008
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: The blog is back and we're in court.
item.itunes:summary: The blog is back and we're in court. The UK government defends its 'proportionate' approach to avoid delays. Nestle children's book prize ends following protests by authors. Demise of the Nestlé Children's Book Prize - Guardian article. Bans and banners.
item.description: The blog is back and we're in court. The UK government defends its 'proportionate' approach to avoid delays. Nestle children's book prize ends following protests by authors. Demise of the Nestlé Children's Book Prize - Guardian article. Bans and banners.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, IDFA, UK, Sean Taylor

item.title: Podcast 24 December 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: ASA ruling on Wyeth's SMA television advertisement
item.itunes:summary: ASA ruling on Wyeth's SMA television advertisement. Political leadership: where to find it. Please contact your Member of Parliament over the UK formula regulations. More on Nestle prizes bringing concerns to wider attention. That's it for 2007.
item.description: ASA ruling on Wyeth's SMA television advertisement. Political leadership: where to find it. Please contact your Member of Parliament over the UK formula regulations. More on Nestle prizes bringing concerns to wider attention. That's it for 2007.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, ASA, UK, Sean Taylor

item.title: Podcast 17 December 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: UK Minister gives wrong answers
item.itunes:summary: Breastfeeding Manifesto tops. Nestle defends branding babies. Sean Taylor, award winning author, refuses Nestle money. Do not fear the European Commission. Proposed UK law: please try again.
item.description: Breastfeeding Manifesto tops. Nestle defends branding babies. Sean Taylor, award winning author, refuses Nestle money. Do not fear the European Commission. Proposed UK law: please try again.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, China, UK, Sean Taylor

item.title: Podcast 10 December 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: UK Minister gives wrong answers
item.itunes:summary: eDemocracy in action in the UK - or perhaps not. UK Minister to answer your questions. Spotlight on rule breakers in Indonesia on Al Jazeera. Minister doesn't listen to the question and gives wrong answers. Politicians listening in Gambia.
item.description: eDemocracy in action in the UK - or perhaps not. UK Minister to answer your questions. Spotlight on rule breakers in Indonesia on Al Jazeera. Minister doesn't listen to the question and gives wrong answers. Politicians listening in Gambia.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, Indonesia, UK, Gambia

item.title: Podcast 3 December 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Global report shames UK
item.itunes:summary: Janipher's story in The Guardian. Nestle Nespresso - something else to boycott. Branded from birth - IBFAN's new monitoring report exposes baby milk marketing trends. Global report shames UK for lack of follow through on health claims crackdown. The influence of the formula and dairy industry in the UK
item.description: Janipher's story in The Guardian. Nestle Nespresso - something else to boycott. Branded from birth - IBFAN's new monitoring report exposes baby milk marketing trends. Global report shames UK for lack of follow through on health claims crackdown. The influence of the formula and dairy industry in the UK
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula

item.title: Podcast 26 November 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Don't mothers who use formula deserve protection?
item.itunes:summary: Is this blog useful? Monitoring company carelines. On dark arts and spinning. Industry response to the UK formula regulations - and photographic evidence. Don't mothers who use formula deserve protection?
item.description: Is this blog useful? Monitoring company carelines. On dark arts and spinning. Industry response to the UK formula regulations - and photographic evidence. Don't mothers who use formula deserve protection?
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula

item.title: Podcast 19 November 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Breastfeeding does not cause breasts to droop
item.itunes:summary: Breastfeeding does not cause breasts to droop, says cosmetic surgeon. Send a message of support to the UK Government as it decides on formula marketing regulations. Dr. Natividad Relucio Clavano. Podcast widget with built in player. Contacting Government Ministers in the UK.
item.description: Breastfeeding does not cause breasts to droop, says cosmetic surgeon. Send a message of support to the UK Government as it decides on formula marketing regulations. Dr. Natividad Relucio Clavano. Podcast widget with built in player. Contacting Government Ministers in the UK.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula

item.title: Podcast 12 November 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: UK Ministers under pressure from formula industry
item.itunes:summary: UK Ministers under pressure from formula industry not to strengthen marketing regulations. Breastfeeding linked to intelligence once again - beware of industry claims for their additives. UK enforcement body wants a better formula law. Important information for accountants about UNICEF Baby Friendly Initiative. UK parents have the right to demand support for breastfeeding and accurate information on reducing risks of formula feeding.
item.description: UK Ministers under pressure from formula industry not to strengthen marketing regulations. Breastfeeding linked to intelligence once again - beware of industry claims for their additives. UK enforcement body wants a better formula law. Important information for accountants about UNICEF Baby Friendly Initiative. UK parents have the right to demand support for breastfeeding and accurate information on reducing risks of formula feeding.
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula

item.title: Podcast 5 November 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Breastfeeding reduces cancer risks says expert report
item.itunes:summary: Wyeth (SMA) television ad still running in the UK as we await action from the ASA. Synchronised breastfeeding world record provisional results. Breastfeeding reduces cancer risks says expert report. Danone to take over Nutricia, Milupa and Cow and Gate. Little Angels are raising breastfeeding rates with one arm tied behind their backs
item.description: Wyeth (SMA) television ad still running in the UK as we await action from the ASA. Synchronised breastfeeding world record provisional results. Breastfeeding reduces cancer risks says expert report. Danone to take over Nutricia, Milupa and Cow and Gate. Little Angels are raising breastfeeding rates with one arm tied behind their backs
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, Nutricia

item.title: Podcast 29 October 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Learning from free lunches in Minnesota
item.itunes:summary: Changing laws to better protect breastfeeding and infants fed on formula is in the news. Bringing up Baby. Learning from free lunches in Minnesota. IBFAN Africa awards Gambian community support work. Little time left to strengthen the UK formula law
item.description: Changing laws to better protect breastfeeding and infants fed on formula is in the news. Bringing up Baby. Learning from free lunches in Minnesota. IBFAN Africa awards Gambian community support work. Little time left to strengthen the UK formula law
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, Philippines

item.title: Podcast 22 October 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Nestle Chief, Peter Brabeck, wins another award - for bad practice
item.itunes:summary: Football star Theo Walcott in The Times supporting breastfeeding. Philippines Health Secretary says protecting public health came above narrow trade interests in Supreme Court victory. Nestle Chief, Peter Brabeck, wins another award - for bad practice. Will the UK Government deliver on its claimed commitment to tackling obesity through breastfeeding? Who owns Lansinoh and are they Code compliant?
item.description: Football star Theo Walcott in The Times supporting breastfeeding. Philippines Health Secretary says protecting public health came above narrow trade interests in Supreme Court victory. Nestle Chief, Peter Brabeck, wins another award - for bad practice. Will the UK Government deliver on its claimed commitment to tackling obesity through breastfeeding? Who owns Lansinoh and are they Code compliant?
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, Philippines

item.title: Podcast 15 October 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: How was protection for infant health in the Philippines achieved?
item.itunes:summary: Philippines campaigner for infant health launches petition calling for US support. Partial victory at Philippines Supreme Court goes some way to protecting infant health - but action is still needed. Philippines court ruling: formula health claims banned, warnings on labels required. Philippines court ruling: who is behind the headlines? How was protection for infant health in the Philippines achieved?
item.description: Philippines campaigner for infant health launches petition calling for US support. Partial victory at Philippines Supreme Court goes some way to protecting infant health - but action is still needed. Philippines court ruling: formula health claims banned, warnings on labels required. Philippines court ruling: who is behind the headlines? How was protection for infant health in the Philippines achieved?
item.itunes:keywords: breastfeeding, boycott, Nestle, infant formula, Philippines

item.title: Podcast 08 October 2007
item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Nestle in Burma - and apartheid South Africa
item.itunes:summary: Nestle in Burma - and apartheid South Africa. Protecting babies in emergencies: The role of the public. Chivers jelly and the list of products from which Nestle profits. Free Burma. Ruling in Belgium : deaths from contaminated formula are to be accepted
item.description: Nestle in Burma - and apartheid South Africa. Protecting babies in emergencies: The role of the public. Chivers jelly and the list of products from which Nestle profits. Free Burma. Ruling in Belgium : deaths from contaminated formula are to be accepted

item.itunes:author: Mike Brady
item.itunes:subtitle: Health oranisations call for the UK Government to implement formula marketing standards
item.itunes:summary: Will the new Nestle boss be the same as the old Nestle boss? Health oranisations call for the UK Government to implement formula marketing standards. Nestle and its cheque book at the Labour Party Conference. Cow and Gate in Tesco exploiting loopholes in UK legislation. The UK law consultation closes - now will the government act?
item.description: Will the new Nestle boss be the same as the old Nestle boss? Health oranisations call for the UK Government to implement formula marketing standards.
